project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Emergency Demobilization and Reintegration Project in Ethiopia, are to demobilize, and reintegrate a hundred and fifty thousand veterans (following the Agreement on the Cessation of Hostilities with Eritrea), and, to support macroeconomic stability in the country. The project includes a quick disbursement mechanism that uses a positive list of emergency imports, to generate counterpart funds to finance rapid project implementation. The primary benefit is the return of veterans to their communities, to resume a productive social, and economic life. A secondary benefit will be the reallocation of resources from defense expenditures, towards poverty reduction and accelerated economic growth. However, the resumption of hostilities is the major external risk, while project specific risks are linked to weak implementation capacity, and the expected rapid pace of demobilization. Full disbursement is expected by December 31, 2003, and a retroactive financing of up to thirty five percent of the total amount of the credit, has been agreed against a positive list of imports made after June 18, 2000.
